documents.document: @NeilReidnz Look, was going to be washing my hair tomorrow night but if I get free of that, absolutely.
Heartland. Chatfield, Furlong, Timu, Ronchi... even Setford... https://t.co/zTkKe62Ucl
Cracker day in Auckland, NZ to bat first, join in some live action, commentary and chat all day long.. https://t.co/ZgNMv0VIDS
Poor maths: Straya 299-20 of course.. https://t.co/Shwjq7X2he
@mdismailsait No idea. If I was going to guess it'd be Southee, Boult, Ferguson, Santner, Neesham and maybe a bit of Munro/Williamson.
@HamishBidwell Got so carried away I forgot to ask. Unlucky there.
@pineyzb @HamishBidwell @liam_hyslop Was a moment of panic, but the hard questions flowed: 'what did you think of the new grass'. Gold.
@liam_hyslop @HamishBidwell Byline correct but I'll take it as a compliment. What a joy it was to get out on the (new) grass with @pineyzb
@max_bania See you there. Will be the height of a Wellington summer by then..
@max_bania Hi Max - not in Chch but this should answer your question, unfortunately.. https://t.co/LI7IaFIKj3
@aotearoaxi Absolutely. Me too.
A shame for the tour. Fantastic player. But a handy leg up for the home side. https://t.co/av6DsWsUeR
@BlackCapsNo1Fan It's just a bit boring to tip a draw..
Kane Williamson addressing NZ team huddle on a sun drenched Basin outfield. Reckon the hosts might win this one today #NZvBAN
To be fair, a few in the press box were tardy this morning too #notnamingnames #NZvBAN
Extraordinary scenes at the Basin. Umpires declare a 10.30am start in the mist and the home team has only just arrived at the ground #NZvBAN
Not surprising, Bangladesh to bat on at the Basin. NZ bowlers warming up on outfield #NZvBAN
Nice touch this. Cracking performance by both batsmen on another record-breaking day at the Basin. https://t.co/ggpviSQecv
@Rotoscribe Absolutely not. Might require some Capt Kane intervention to get the breakthrough here, via golden arm..
@Sportsfreakconz @Sportificator @SnakeMcHardy Almost verging on too much information territory there. Punters flooding in now: 5 on hill.
@Sportificator @SnakeMcHardy @Sportsfreakconz The very one.
@SnakeMcHardy @Sportsfreakconz Dare I say the hill crowd has now trebled to 3. A certain figure with a flag at far end..
@Sportsfreakconz Current crowd figure on the hill: 1.
@Sportsfreakconz Indeed - best rain gauge of the day
Play can continue till 7.30pm we're being told. Black Caps in a huddle on the boundary but it's very dark again #NZvBAN
Good news, covers off and play resumes at 5.45pm #NZvBAN
@max_bania No front on camera, no DRS allowed. I'd advise you go back to sleep, looking very bleak here. Much better forecast tomorrow..
@oneforthedr Do a few tough laps of the roundabout then come on in. Plenty of spare seats..
It's time for some Wagner after 19 overs. 41 test wickets at 21 in 2016 #NZvBAN
Reckon that one looked less out than the previous review #NZvBAN
Still reckon that Tamim lbw was out. Have minimal faith in ball tracker and the side on replay showed it wasn't going over the top #NZvBAN
But in good news for hungry hangers-on everywhere, umpires have called an early lunch. Whether play resumes later is another matter #NZvBAN
Bleak would be a kind way of describing the scene at the Basin. Covers on, rain sweeping across and Vance Stand rattling in the gale #NZvBAN
One hour into first test, players off the field and Chris Cross' "Ride Like The Wind" is playing on the speakers #basinlife #NZvBAN
Going a touch early here but de Grandhomme may prove NZ's most effective bowler in the gale, nibbling off the surface #NZvBAN
No swing at all for Boult in that first over despite wind assistance #NZvBAN
In other news, Nigel Llong is listed as TV umpire for this test. No further comment #couldhavecomefromanything #NZvBAN
Staying upright in 'breeze' might be biggest challenge for NZ bowlers on a soft Basin pitch. NZ 1st innings lasted 48 overs v Aust in Feb
Rocking and rolling at Basin. Quake then rapid northerly wobbling the Vance Stand and causing havoc with Bangladesh's warmup football game.
@BlackCapsNo1Fan There's a cast of thousands in here, plenty of hangers on as per usual. Sure you could have talked your way in..
Decent cordon with Brownlie the thrower: Taylor, Raval, Southee, de Grandhomme. Might get a few their way too. https://t.co/KPaJQJlCBR
And what a wee beauty it is (bright green strip in centre). Standard fare now at Basin 2 days out. https://t.co/s1O60Nel8E
Big crowd in for pace bowling test debutant Taskin Ahmed at the Basin. Big grin when asked about emerald pitch. https://t.co/KzynKfCL6t
@Arrmaan7 Without any inside info I'll take a stab at Worker, Blundell and Ferguson in for Neesham, Ronchi and Wheeler.
@sachinkumar3150 Guessing those 3 will all play. Enjoy the game.
@sachinkumar3150 At a guess, on a used pitch, Worker, Blundell and Ferguson in for Neesham, Ronchi and Wheeler (on… https://t.co/rw12x6lfr4
@NiallGunner @Sportsfreakconz First 4 losses all narrow ones then senior men took charge. And if Dernbach/Gulbis w… https://t.co/n8tCzDKPOc
Take a bow Hamish Marshall. Admitted to virtually no captaincy experience when arrived, Birds win 7 of last 8 and n… https://t.co/fMqGBtopGe
@girvana A shame because I like seeing LR do well but that was almost a sacrifice bunt. If they wanted a WK to bat… https://t.co/Ab4WeVoZrO
Not a big fan of Ronchi opening. They called Worker in, should have played him. And still headed to NP for final tomorrow
@sachinmani07 @NitinJhansi I'm not at the ground today so no idea on selection, sorry. Our man @boxcarfred is all o… https://t.co/m5z51UhlQj
@NitinJhansi Boult definitely, Sodhi depends on pitch. If it's dry they could play 2 spinners and rest a quick.
Cracking call from @buster125 on wireless there. Got Luke Woodcock, Johnsonville CC and comments man @HorseyMillmow in same sentence.
@shaneyoung72 Hope not, bit of a cloud about might help. Surely sun can't strike twice..
Handshakes and applause all round as Lockie Ferguson, Tom Bruce and Ben Wheeler receive their first NZ T20 caps in team huddle #NZvBAN
@sachinmani07 Neesham is currently giving throwdowns to the skipper which is a signal he's not playing.
@AneeshChandoke I am, but no confirmed team news yet.
Bit of time honoured Five5 at the Basin. Firebirds 0-1 in very shortest format after that Chch Super Over. https://t.co/PycP5gRUht
@adrianseconinz I'm in Napier but from what I'm hearing not great.
@shortflyslip Fair points re fairness. Just needs a blanket rule at start of comp saying hours can be extended to allow a game to start.
@shaneyoung72 Fair play. Certainly the form team on a roll. Likely rematch in NP on Sat too.
@shaneyoung72 Big Stags fan, but Aces comfortably I reckon. Need victory to host playoff on Thursday and nothing on it for the visitors.
In happier news in Napier, the odd 7pm start time has proved an unlikely masterstroke and rain is forecast to clear in time for T20 #NZvBAN
@MarkCurrieNZ It sounds about right. Minimum 5 overs per side. Forecast to clear around 5-6pm, just makes no sense not to extend hours.
Cruel way to go out if this rain continues. Never worked out why play can't be extended till, say, 8pm to fit in su… https://t.co/e7bKSSIK1l
@liamnapierffx Agree. Ideal time to test Blundell out, and Mark Chapman as a spinning allrounder. And I'd rest Will… https://t.co/HJVN8eUTic
Fully deserved NZ T20 callup for @TomBruce42 unlucky not to be an international already in 2016 https://t.co/hdYsoSqCvb
@KarthikRobben No, watching on TV feeling sluggish and overfed. Chris Barclay our man at the ground after dominatin… https://t.co/hvw2tn44hT
@HamishBidwell Don't know but hopefully about to find out. Assume he's confused too.
@HamishBidwell It's beyond me but still clearly visible on FB for interlopers. Best 2-word caption of any social media post by a cricketer.
Neil Broom bolts back into Black Caps, Luke Ronchi returns to reclaim gloves https://t.co/dkowxv38BH
@boxcarfred @legslip1 Was actually asleep and the camera flash woke me up.
Lockie Ferguson warming up and Matt Henry is not. So looks 2 changes from Canberra: Ferguson for Henry and Nicholls for Neesham #AUSvNZ
Looks like Henry Nicholls in for the injured Jimmy Neesham for NZ. No Todd Astle who's throwing slips catches #AUSvNZ
Jimmy Neesham ruled out of 3rd ODI as swelling on his arm hasn't eased. Official from NZ team #ausvnz
@BlackCapsNo1Fan @Sportsfreakconz Forecast better tomorrow. May be rain-shortened but should get some game in at The Big G.
@samworthingtown @legslip1 That's good. Been working to get my deficit under 1min. Progress.
The G. Sadly, umbrellas mandatory today. https://t.co/s8UNOSSqlr
Not a great day to be a Kiwi at Manuka Oval. The blokes in beige just lost the outfield tug-of-war to Australia to level that series up 1-1.
Drinks with Australia 84-1 off 17 and well set for a 4th 300-plus total from as many ODIs in Canberra. Very ominous for must-win NZ.
@bradmanesque Indeed. Need to stick to the when in Australia rule: bat first every time (except maybe in Hobart tests).
Boult will remember how tough it is to bowl at Manuka. Played 1st game for NZ v PM's XI as skinny teenager in 2009. Got a J Langer lesson.
Still think it's strange NZ didn't try to take Aust out of comfort zone by batting. Aust won all 3 ODIs here batting first and going big.
Pleasant ground, this, but very small crowd in at Manuka. Plenty of empty seats in both Bob Hawke and Sir Donald Bradman Stands #straya
Here we go. Australia openers out there. Black Caps confirm Lockie Ferguson not injured, just not selected #AUSvNZ
Big call from Williamson to bowl first, clearly weather related. Might be bit in it early but Australia won't be unhappy batting.
Lot of stuffing around out there, with covers off and roller on. Cast of thousands. Coin toss shortly, start at 4.35pm NZT #AUSvNZ
@shortflyslip Often difficult to resist temptation to write "coach Hessian is lying on the wicket". And he's just removed himself too..
Interesting Oz looking to omit their specialist spinner. Looks like 1 change apiece: Southee for Ferguson and Faulkner for Zampa #AUSvNZ
@Sportsfreakconz Haven't heard for sure but assume it is rotated. Fair call too.
Players warming up but coin toss delayed as light rain falls. Southee, Henry, Boult having a bowl in the centre with Ferguson out.
Last 6 Canberra ODIs won by team batting first. Australia 3-0 here, with winning totals of 329 (v WI) 329 (v SA) and 348 (v India) #AUSvNZ
One hour till scheduled start. Bit of a waiting game out there with spits of rain, hessian cover on and NZ players booting a football
@footy_1717 @KaranVenter Haven't had a close look and it's under hessian cover now. Earlier look suggested it was a belter.
Tim Southee marking out his run so he'll be back in for Ferguson. Henry and Boult also there. Same NZ pace trio as World Cup final #ausvnz
Our friendly BureauOM has upgraded forecast to 50% chance of rain. Australian players warming up under brighter skies. V promising #AUSvNZ
@KaranVenter 80 percent chance of rain, improving later. Feels like we'll get a light dousing at some point but holding for now
Rain holding off at Manuka, for now. Fingers crossed for start on time just over 2hr from now #ausvnz https://t.co/rKpCWJBTai
Lot of inside edges and variable bounce early. Might be a tough chase on this pitch #AUSvNZ
Some way to settle the nerves. David Warner not a bad one for your first ODI wicket. At 148.5kmh #AUSvNZ
